result.execSummary:
The defendant Michael E. Sullivan was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly conduct - domestic [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse]. This is not a criminal offense and results only in a money penalty for this offense.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Fine to be paid within 60 days.  Penalty of civil judgment for non-payment.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Michael E. Sullivan

records.addlTxt:
Case called at 1:47 PM
Attorney Andrew Nettesheim in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Attorney Adam Joseph Kachelski in court for Michael E. Sullivan.  
Defendant Michael E. Sullivan in court. 
State moves to amend count 1 to a county ordinance of Disorderly Conduct with Domestic Abuse, Statute 13-102(c)(8)     .
Defendant has no objections.  Court grants the amendment.
Defendant enters a plea of No Contest to the amended charge.
Court finds the defendant Guilty of the amended charge.

Court orders the following:
Fine:  $330.50
Domestic Abuse Surcharge:  $100.00
To be paid in 60-days.
Penalty:  Entry of a Civil Judgment
Plea/sentencing hearing on September 26, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
Plea/sentencing hearing on September 26, 2022 at 02:00 pm.

9:32 AM   File not called on the record.
Charles Patrick Hoffmann appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Attorney Adam Joseph Kachelski in court by zoom and appears by authorizaton.   Defendant Michael E. Sullivan did not appear.  
All parties have agreed that some may have the hearing conducted remotely. This hearing has met the statutory standards for video conferencing.
Attorney Kachelski requests a plea/sentencing date.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for September 26, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
Hearing on July 8, 2022 at 09:30 am.

08:32 AM Not called on the record.  Attorney Adam Joseph Kachelski in court.  Attorney appears by authorization.   Defendant Michael E. Sullivan did not appear.   Abbey Nickolie appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Kachelski requests a date for resolution in September as the defendant is currently in treatment.  The Court will set a status date in July to check on the status of treatment.  Court will allow parties to appear by zoom for the status date.  Hearing scheduled for July 8, 2022 at 09:30 am.
Authorization for Appearance;  filed by Atty. Adam Kachelski
Motion and Order to Seal Victim Impact Statement signed by Judge Melvin on 3-25-2022
Proposed Order to Seal Victim Impact Statement
Hearing on May 20, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Amended to Signature Bond. Refund bond to poster.

Cash bail previously posted to be refunded to poster.  Absolute sobriety, defendant is not to possess or consume any alcohol.  Defendant is not to have any violent contact with victim A listed in the Criminal Complaint/Victim Identification Key.   Defendant is not to share, reproduce or distribute any personal and/or identifying information about the crime victim(s), except to their attorney.  Defendant is not to use/possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription and take as prescribed.  Defendant not to possess any drug paraphernalia.

08:42 AM Defendant Michael E. Sullivan in court with attorney Adam Joseph Kachelski.  Christian Farina appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defense acknowledges receipt of complaint and victim key and waives reading of complaint.  Service admitted/advised of charges and potential penalties.  NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED.  Hearing scheduled for May 20, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Defendant's Demand for Discovery and Inspection.
